name: Cleric
description: A priestly champion who wields divine magic in service of a higher power.
starting_equipment: Scale Mail, Leather Armor, or Chain Mail (if proficient)
Light Crossbow and 20 Bolts or any Simple Weapon

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: As a conduit for divine power, you can cast cleric spells. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your cleric spells.

features.name: Divine Domain
features.description: At 1st level, you choose a domain shaped by your deity or spiritual path. Your choice grants you domain spells and other features when you choose it at 1st level and additional benefits at 2nd, 6th, 8th, and 17th levels.

features.name: Channel Divinity
features.description: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to channel divine energy directly from your deity, using that energy to fuel magical effects. You start with two such effects: Turn Undead and an effect determined by your domain. You can use Channel Divinity once, and regain the ability after a short or long rest.

features.name: Divine Domain Feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your Divine Domain.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Destroy Undead (CR 1/2)
features.description: Starting at 5th level, when an undead fails its saving throw against your Turn Undead feature, the creature is instantly destroyed if its challenge rating is at or below 1/2.

features.name: Channel Divinity (2/rest)
features.description: You can use your Channel Divinity twice between rests.

features.name: Divine Domain Feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your Divine Domain.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Destroy Undead (CR 1)
features.description: Your Destroy Undead feature now affects undead with CR 1 or lower.

features.name: Divine Domain Feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your Divine Domain.

features.name: Divine Intervention
features.description: Beginning at 10th level, you can call on your deity to intervene on your behalf. You can use this feature once, and must finish a long rest before you can use it again. At 20th level, this succeeds automatically.

features.name: Destroy Undead (CR 2)
features.description: Your Destroy Undead feature now affects undead with CR 2 or lower.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Destroy Undead (CR 3)
features.description: Your Destroy Undead feature now affects undead with CR 3 or lower.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Destroy Undead (CR 4)
features.description: Your Destroy Undead feature now affects undead with CR 4 or lower.

features.name: Divine Domain Feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your Divine Domain.

features.name: Channel Divinity (3/rest)
features.description: You can use your Channel Divinity three times between rests.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Divine Intervention Improvement
features.description: At 20th level, your call for divine intervention succeeds automatically, no roll required.

subclasses.name: Life Domain
subclasses.description: The Life domain focuses on the vibrant positive energy that sustains all life. Clerics of this domain are masters of healing, using divine magic to cure the wounded and restore life to the fallen.

1.name: Bonus Proficiency
1.description: You gain proficiency with heavy armor.

1.name: Disciple of Life
1.description: Your healing spells are more effective. Whenever you use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

subclasses.name: Light Domain
subclasses.description: Gods of light promote the ideals of rebirth and renewal, truth, vigilance, and beauty, often using the symbol of the sun. Clerics of a god of light are enlightened souls infused with radiance and the power of their gods' discerning vision.

1.name: Bonus Cantrip
1.description: You gain the Light cantrip if you don't already know it.

1.name: Warding Flare
1.description: You can interpose divine light between yourself and an attacking enemy. When you are attacked by a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclasses.name: Trickery Domain
subclasses.description: Gods of trickery are mischief-makers and instigators who stand as a constant challenge to the accepted order among both gods and mortals. Clerics of these gods are a disruptive force in the world, puncturing pride, mocking tyrants, stealing from the rich, and freeing the downtrodden.

1.name: Blessing of the Trickster
1.description: You can use your action to touch a willing creature other than yourself to give it advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. This blessing lasts for 1 hour or until you use this feature again.

subclasses.name: War Domain
subclasses.description: War has many manifestations. It can make heroes of ordinary people. It can be desperate and horrific, with acts of cruelty and cowardice eclipsing instances of excellence and courage. In either case, the gods of war watch over warriors and reward them for their great deeds.

1.name: Bonus Proficiency
1.description: You gain proficiency with martial weapons and heavy armor.

1.name: War Priest
1.description: When you use the Attack action, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
